p:
Ensemble mean estimates of the epidemiological parameters D and R
0 for RSV at outbreak peak are shown in Fig 2. At the simulated epidemic peak, the mean values of D and R
0 were 6.4 days and 3.0, respectively. During the period of forecast, there is little variation of these estimates, though the minimum, 5 th percentile, 95 th percentile, and maximum parameter values vary more ( S5 Fig). R
0 shows some geographic variability and is consistently lower in Census Division 5 (mean R
0 = 2.5), which stretches from Florida to Maryland ( S6 and S7 Figs). Depending on season and location, D and R
0 vary between about 5–9 and 1.5–4, respectively ( S7 Fig). Estimates of the parameter D, but not R
0 , were found to be sensitive to γ ( S8 Fig).
